intro: Chenopodium sinuatum, commonly known as waved blite, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, lanceolate leaves with wavy margins. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are followed by triangular, beak-shaped seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Chenopodium sinuatum is valued for its nutritional content and has been used in traditional diets and herbal remedies.
